§1[Rituals & Rites]

 Now that we know what ritual patterns are what, actual ritual casting can be done. There are five (5) types of rituals, one for each elixir. They each have things they do, some more useful than others but all are
§1are useful in their own way, even if that way is small.

§1[Weather]

 Weather rituals, as the name states, alter the weather itself. Covering the skies with clouds and wiping it clean of them is possible with these rituals.

§1|Rite of Rainfall|

Ritual Sequence:
1) Elixir of the Conduit
2) Crushed Fern
3) Water Bottle

XP Cost: 2 XP Levels

Ritual Pattern:
Asmodais' Diagram
§1This rite magically augments the weather to make it rain.§r

§1|Rite of Clear Skies|

Ritual Sequence:
1) Elixir of the Conduit
2) Crushed Fern
3) Glowstone Dust

XP Cost: 2 XP Levels

Ritual Pattern:
Asmodais' Diagram
§1This rite magically augments the weather to stop rain and storms.§r

§1|Rite of the Storms|

Ritual Sequence:
1) Elixir of the Conduit
2) Crushed Fern
3) Crushed Blue Orchid

XP Cost: 2 XP Levels

Ritual Pattern:
Asmodais' Diagram
§1This rite magically augments the weather to create thunderstorms.§r

§1[Conjuration]

 Conjuration Rites are used to conjure up creatures. This is limited to passive creatures and even undead ones. Conjure at your risk, however. Witches have been known to be killed by these rites.

§1|Calling of the Passive|

Ritual Sequence:
1) Soul Bottle
2) Emerald Dust
3) Wheat

XP Cost: 4 XP Levels
Ritual Pattern:
Endarg's Conjuration Circle
§1This rite conjures a random passive mob when interacted with a Mundane Wand. It can be a sheep, cow, pig or even a bird like a parrot or chicken.
§1However, a Witch can also use this ritual to conjure other creatures if the right item is substituted with the Mundane Wand. The items are as follows:

§1Seeds (Parrot)
Salmon/Cod (Cat)
Bone (Wolf)
Seagrass (Turtle)
Slimeball (Frog)

§1|Conjure the Undead|

Ritual Sequence:
1) Soul Bottle
2) Dirt
3) Rotten Flesh

XP Cost: 5 XP Levels

Ritual Pattern:
Endarg's Conjuration Ring

§1A very popular rite among the inexperienced and foolish. It conjures a random undead mob to combat the player. Be prepared though; Zombies are easily dealt with but Wither Skeletons are a different story.

§1More adept Witches do use it, however. By substituting the Mundane Wand for the right §2Primal Crystal§1, the undead mob conjured can be augmented, eg. Solar Crystals narrow down the conjured to only Wither Skeletons & Husks.§r

§1[Transmutation]

 Arguably the most powerful rituals a witch can perform, Transmutation Rituals can magically change certain blocks into others, making them great for acquiring resources.

§1|Rite of Mycelic Corruption|

Ritual Sequence:
1) Essence of the Forest
2) Dirt
3) Red/Brown Mushroom

XP Cost: 8 XP Levels
Ritual Pattern:
Remus' Transmogrification
§1This rite transmutes grass, dirt and coarse dirt blocks into mycelium.§r

§1|Rite of Liquid Conversion|

Ritual Sequence:
1) Essence of the Forest
2) Empty Bucket
3) Natural Ash

XP Cost: 7 XP Levels
Ritual Pattern:
Remus' Transmogrification
§1This rite transmutes water into lava.§r

§1|Rite of Mineral Exchange|

Ritual Sequence:
1) Essence of the Forest
2) Stone
3) Natural Ash

XP Cost: 10 XP Levels
Ritual Pattern:
Remus' Transmogrification

§1This rite transmutes a few specific blocks of metal/minerals into the ores of another. (Char)Coal Block => Copper Ore, Raw Copper Block => Iron Ore, Raw Iron Block => Gold Ore, Raw Gold Block => Emerald Ore, Emerald Block => Diamond Ore & Quartz Block =>
§1Amethyst Cluster.

§4[Infernal]

 Infernal rites are as its name says. They conjure denizens of the Nether. As such, they use the same ritual pattern as Conjuration Rites but with more...organic items.

§4|Conjure Flame Horde|

Ritual Sequence:
1) Blood Vial
2) Crushed Obsidian
3) Natural Ash

XP Cost: 6 XP Levels

Ritual Pattern:
Endarg's Conjuration Ring
§4This ritual conjures Blazes and/or Magma Cubes within the ritual pattern. Despite the obvious dangers of this ritual, it is still widely used as it is a foolproof way of gaining certain resources.

§4|Infernal Offering|

Ritual Sequence:
1) Blood Vial
2) Natural Ash
3) Raw Porkchop

XP Cost: 4 XP Levels

Ritual Pattern:
Endarg's Conjuration Ring

§4This is an ancient ritual dedicated to the Father of Fire, §cSolaris§4. While most other ancient rituals of the Gods have been abandoned, this one still remains as Solaris is known to offer gifts of the Nether on completion.

§1[Infusion]

 These are ancient rituals used to perfectly align a witch with an element, making it apart of them. It has very strict requirements, however.

§1|Solar Infusion|

Ritual Sequence:
1) Holy Water
2) Solar Vial
3) Diamond

XP Cost: 10 XP Levels

Ritual Pattern:
Archaic Purifying Circle
§1This ritual MUST be performed in the Nether. It infuses the witch with the energy of the Sun.

§1|Lunar Infusion|

Ritual Sequence:
1) Holy Water
2) Moon Blessed Water
3) Diamond

XP Cost: 10 XP Levels

Ritual Pattern:
Archaic Purifying Circle
§1This ritual MUST be performed on a Beach at Midnight. It infuses the witch with the energy of the Moon and is the only Infusion ritual that uses an Elixir.

§1|Earth Infusion|

Ritual Sequence:
1) Holy Water
2) Overworld Mana
3) Diamond

XP Cost: 10 XP Levels

Ritual Pattern:
Archaic Purifying Circle
§1This ritual MUST be performed in a Forest. It infuses the witch with the energy of the Earth.

§1|Sky Infusion|

Ritual Sequence:
1) Holy Water
2) Stormy Mana
3) Diamond

XP Cost: 10 XP Levels

Ritual Pattern:
Archaic Purifying Circle
§1This ritual MUST be performed under the rain. It infuses the witch with the energy of the Sky.

§1|Ender Infusion|

Ritual Sequence:
1) Holy Water
2) Contained Void
3) Diamond

XP Cost: 10 XP Levels

Ritual Pattern:
Archaic Purifying Circle
§1This ritual MUST be performed in The End. It infuses the witch with the energy of Ender.

§1|Curse Cleansing|

Ritual Sequence:
1) Holy Water
2) Glowstone Dust
3) Fermented Spider Eye

XP Cost: 5 XP Levels

Ritual Pattern:
Archaic Purifying Circle
§1This ritual rids all mobs in a 4 block radius of any curse that has been placed on them.
